title: Ticket #1804: ClassAdList assumes ownership of ads
description:
In old classads, there was a convoluted system for reference counting to manage memory when a classad belonged to multiple ClassAdLists. When the compatibility implementation of ClassAdList was made for new ClassAds, this appears to have inadvertently been dropped. The result is that when an ad belongs to multiple lists and the destructors of those lists are invoked, the ad will be deleted multiple times, likely causing the program to crash.

Brian Bockelman has observed crashes of the negotiator due to a bad free in ClassAdList::~ClassAdList. This could be a result of the bug described above.

I have been able to produce a crash of the negotiator caused by this problem by using the following configuration: 

GROUP_NAMES = physics
GROUP_QUOTA_DYNAMIC_physics = 0.5

The problem also appears if I do not define a quota at all. It does not appear if I define GROUP_QUOTA_physics to something > 0. The reason is that when there is a static quota defined, the negotiator appears to manage the submitter ads in a way that avoids the ads remaining in two ClassAdList objects when those objects are destroyed.

The job that I submit to cause the problem doesn't have to even be a member of any group. Example: 

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 3600
notification = never
queue

Valgrind reports the following error in the negotiator: 

==29756== Invalid read of size 4
==29756==    at 0x81EC5BE: compat_classad::ClassAdList::~ClassAdList() (compat_classad_list.cpp:51)
==29756==    by 0x811BD06: Matchmaker::negotiationTime() (matchmaker.cpp:1373)
==29756==    by 0x8145A29: TimerManager::Timeout() (timer_manager.cpp:413)
==29756==    by 0x812EF1C: DaemonCore::Driver() (daemon_core.cpp:3092)
==29756==    by 0x81268E7: main (daemon_core_main.cpp:2356)
==29756==  Address 0x44b5330 is 0 bytes inside a block of size 100 free'd
==29756==    at 0x4005234: operator delete(void*) (vg_replace_malloc.c:346)
==29756==    by 0x8220CD8: compat_classad::ClassAd::~ClassAd() (compat_classad.cpp:684)
==29756==    by 0x81EC5D1: compat_classad::ClassAdList::~ClassAdList() (compat_classad_list.cpp:51)
==29756==    by 0x81142A1: Matchmaker::SimpleGroupEntry::~SimpleGroupEntry() (matchmaker.cpp:1389)
==29756==    by 0x811BA9E: Matchmaker::negotiationTime() (matchmaker.cpp:1342)
==29756==    by 0x8145A29: TimerManager::Timeout() (timer_manager.cpp:413)
==29756==    by 0x812EF1C: DaemonCore::Driver() (daemon_core.cpp:3092)
==29756==    by 0x81268E7: main (daemon_core_main.cpp:2356)

How to Fix

One option would be to add reference counting. To do this right, we would need to consistently use it in all places where pointers to ClassAds are passed around. We could cheat and only apply it in the case of ClassAdList, but I think this is unexpected.

For now, I am just adding a second version of the class called ClassAdListDoesNotDeleteAds. One should only ever put a classad in a single ClassAdList. It can exist in multiple instances of ClassAdListDoesNotDeleteAds.

The only place I have found where this new class needs to be used is in the negotiator for the startd and schedd ads.
remarks:
2010-Dec-12 16:05:41 by danb:
It is likely that Brian's problem was not due to the bug described in this ticket. Instead, it is likely that it was caused by my changes in #1773 that made ClassAdList incompatible with shallow copying as done by qsort of arrays in the negotiator containing ClassAdList.

2010-Dec-11 00:26   Check-in [19634]: Fix for ads in multiple ClassAdLists getting deleted multiple times. #1804 ClassAdList has wonky semantics. It should really just go away and be replaced by STL. In the mean time, I added ClassAdListDoesNotDeleteAds, which is just like ClassAdList, but it doesn't delete the ads in the list. (By Dan Bradley )
